ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to understand literature from a different perspective. I now enjoy and plan on befriending literature for the rest of my life. It became part of who I am.

I learned various approaches to travel writing, and how to appreciate and analyze them. Furthermore, the course helped me with bringing my own travel writings into form with significant revisions with Professor Wetters.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Its' strength was that via discussions with the grad students, you were able to incorporate extensive background knowledge related to the material.
The course is very interesting, although the majority of the readings relate to depressed individuals traveling their respective parts of the globe.

The strength of the course lies in the readings and the professor. Professor Wetters is very knowledgeable and leads the class well, and it's been marvelous to learn from him. And most of the readings are very captivating. If I had to point to a weakness, I would say it was the absence of some theory near the beginning of the course that would guide the students in their readings though Professor Wetters provided some near the end, which I found helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Although there are graduate students and many history majors, the professor gives one on one feedback and this is what Yale can offer at its peak.

Professor Wetters truly cares about his students and does a great job meeting one-on-one with students to improve their writing ability. He is clear about the expectations throughout the course, and the workload is manageable. I would definitely recommend this course to any student with an interest in travel and travel writing.
